## Discussion

Some cameras, including iPhone cameras, capture depth data in addition to image data. Providing this data can help [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PhotogrammetrySession] determine the real-world scale of the photographed object and result in a correctly sized 3D object for placement in an AR scene. This property is read-only.

Depth data can be in either [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreVideo/kCVPixelFormatType_DisparityFloat32] or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreVideo/kCVPixelFormatType_DepthFloat32] format.

# depthDataMap

**Instance Property**

The image’s depth data.

## Declaration

```swift
var depthDataMap: CVPixelBuffer? { get set }
```

## Discussion

Some cameras, including iPhone cameras, capture depth data in addition to image data. Providing this data can help [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PhotogrammetrySession] determine the real-world scale of the photographed object and result in a correctly sized 3D object for placement in an AR scene. This property is read-only.

Depth data can be in either [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreVideo/kCVPixelFormatType_DisparityFloat32] or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreVideo/kCVPixelFormatType_DepthFloat32] format.

## Describing the sample

- **image**: The image data for this sample.
- **metadata**: An image’s EXIF metadata.
- **gravity**: An image’s gravity vector.
- **objectMask**: The image’s object mask.

items.description: The image data for this sample.
